titlestmt.titleproper:
Tammy Rae Carland "I (heart) Amy Carter" Riot Grrrl Collection
1989-1996
MSS 290
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Laura Newsome, 2010.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-05-09T10:43-0400

did.unittitle: Tammy Rae Carland "I (heart) Amy Carter" Riot Grrrl Collection
did.abstract: Tammy Tae Carland is a Professor at the California College of the Arts where she also chairs the Photography Program. In the 1990's Carland produced a series of fanzines, including I (heart) Amy Carter and Thorn. From 1997-2005 she co-ran Mr. Lady Records and Videos, an independent record label and video art distribution company that was dedicated to the production and distribution of queer and feminist culture. The Collection consists of zines I (heart) Amy Carter, Jailhouse Turn Out, and Thorn; correspondence from friends and fans, mostly requesting copies of the zines; and ephemera. Items in the collection range from 1989-1996.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Tammy Rae Carland Riot Grrrl Collection; MSS 290; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p:
Tammy Rae Carland was born in Portland, Maine in 1965. She received her BA from The Evergreen State College, an MFA from UC Irvine, and attended the Whitney Independent Study Program. She is a Professor at the California College of the Arts, where she also chairs the Photography Program. Carland is represented by Silverman Gallery in San Francisco, and primarily works with photography, experimental video and small run publications. Her photographs have been published in several books, including The Passionate Camera; Queer Bodies of Desire, and Lesbian Art in America. Carland's fanzine writing has been republished in A Girl’s Guide to Taking Over the World. She has also published photographs and received reviews of her work in numerous national media.
In the 1990's Carland produced a series of fanzines, including I (heart) Amy Carter and Thorn. She collaborated on the record art for bands Bikini Kill, The Fakes and The Butchies. From 1997-2005 she co-ran Mr. Lady Records and Videos, an independent record label and video art distribution company that was dedicated to the production and distribution of queer and feminist culture.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Tammy Rae Carland "I (heart) Amy Carter" Riot Grrrl Collection was donated by Carland to NYU Libraries in 2010.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged alphabetically within each series. There are three series:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Tammy Rae Carland "I (heart) Amy Carter" Riot Grrrl Collection contains materials pertaining to Carland's work on zines in the 1990's, focusing on I (heart) Amy Carter. The collection consists of correspondence from friends and fans, mostly requesting copies of the zines; copies of I (heart) Amy Carter, Jailhouse Turn Out, and Thorn; and ephemera. Items in the collection range from 1992-1996, with the bulk from 1993-1995.

did.unittitle: Richar, Mark; Gutierrez, Cris (Heat Seeking Publishing)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This dress was worn in a photograph taken by Tammy Rae Carland, which was used as the album cover for Bikini Kill's Pussy Whipped.
